item.title: Ticket #624 (xml reserved characters in urls cause invalid opml) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #624 (xml reserved characters in urls cause invalid opml) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
If a url in the link manager has a reserved xml character, it will cause the exported opml to be invalid xml.

& is the character I ran across, but I assume it is the same for all reserved characters.

item.title: Ticket #622 (Add two-dialogue-box method for link) updated
item.dc:creator: zealousagenda
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #622 (Add two-dialogue-box method for link) created
item.dc:creator: zealousagenda
item.description:
Invision Power Board (​http://invisionboard.com) among other online post applications uses a two-dialogue-box method for inserting links. After clicking the "link" button, a first box appears, where you insert the URL you would like to link to. When you click on OK for the first box, a second box automatically appears where you'd input the text that you would like to be linked. Clicking OK on the second box then inserts the full code, with closed tags. It's clean and easy, and for me it's become a habit based on my use of the other apps.

What would be slick is if the code would insert at the location where I originally placed the cursor, instead of always inserting it at the end of the post. I don't think about links until afterward--I think about thoughts first, and then create links to substantiate/elucidate my view.

Thank you.

item.title: Ticket #617 (Exerpt part of advanced editing does not work correctly.) updated
item.dc:creator: Cordman
item.description: After doing some digging, I found a reference to the excerpt that says one has to put <?php the_excerpt(); ?> in "The Loop", so I guess this is not a bug per se, but an incomplete "feature".

item.title: Changeset [2042]: List pages, if any, in the sidebar.

item.description: List pages, if any, in the sidebar.

item.title: Ticket #621 (Email notification for UTF-8 Comments garbled) updated
item.dc:creator: pankajnarula
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #621 (Email notification for UTF-8 Comments garbled) created
item.dc:creator: pankajnarula
item.description:
This issue has been there for a long time. Apologies for reporting it late. Whenever someone writes a comment in double byte language, if set an email is sent to the Blog Admin which contains the text of the comment. This text in the comment gets garbled, almost as if the encoding is not being set correctly.

You can replicate this issue by copy some text from let's say ​http://akshargram.com which has Hindi text and pasting it in your WP 1.5 blog. The notification you would get would be garbled.

Pankaj
